sentence.Network_en: Early American weathervanes were most often cut from flat wooden boards.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国早期的风向标大多截自平直的木板。

sentence.Network_en: They would have liked bare wooden floors throughout the house.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们本想在整个房间的木地板上都不铺地毯的。

sentence.Network_en: To avoid damaging the tree, hammer a wooden peg into the hole.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了不毁坏树，用锤子将一个木栓钉进洞里。

means.word_mean: 僵硬的,呆头呆脑的,笨拙的
无感觉的,无表情的,无生命的

entry.def: Wooden objects are made of wood.

example.ex: ...the shop's bare brick walls and faded wooden floorboards.
example.tran: 商店裸露的砖墙和褪色的木地板

entry.tran: (演员)呆板的，死板的，无活力的
entry.def: If you describe an actor as wooden, you are critical of them because their performance is not at all lively or natural.

means.word_mean: 1. made or consisting of (entirely or in part) or employing wood;

example.en: You might consider taking a job here with me, wooden-and-water joey，general rouseabout.
example.zh: 你也许可以考虑跟我一起在这里干活当佣人，打杂。

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表动词,"变成"; 2. 表形容词,"由……制成的",通常加在名词后面; 3. 表名词,"人或物"

stems_affixes.word_buile: strait海峡,困难+en变成→adj.艰难的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 金黄色的;贵重的,极好的
stems_affixes.word_buile: gold金+en由……制成的→adj.金黄色的;贵重的,极好的
oak橡树+en由……制成的→adj.橡木制的
wax蜡+en由……制成的→adj.蜡的,蜡制的
wood木头+en由……制成的→adj.木制的;呆笨的
wool羊毛+en由……制成的→adj. 羊毛[制]的;毛纺的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 未婚的,纯洁的,无经验的
stems_affixes.word_buile: maid少女+en人或物→n.少女,处女 adj.未婚的,纯洁的,无经验的
chick小鸡+en人或物→n.鸡肉;鸡,小鸡,小鸟
city城市+en人或物→citizen
heath荒野,树丛+en人或物→n.异教徒
kit=cat猫+en人或物→kitten
maid少女+en人或物→n.少女,处女 adj.未婚的,纯洁的,无经验的
vix雌狐+en人或物→n.雌狐,泼妇
ward守卫,看守+en人或物→n.看守人,管理员
bright明亮的+en变成→v.[使]变亮,[使]愉快
broad宽+en变成→v.放宽,变阔
damp潮湿+en变成→v.[使]潮湿,使沮丧,泼凉水
dark黑+en变成→v.[使]变黑[变暗]
fright惊骇,吃惊+en变成→v.使惊吓;惊恐
hast匆忙+en变成→v.催促 v.赶紧
length长,长度+en变成→v.延长,[使]变长
sharp尖+en变成→v.削尖,使敏锐
short短+en变成→v.弄短,缩小,减少
sweet甜+en变成→v.使变甜 v.变甜
threat恐吓,凶兆,威胁I+en变成→v.恐吓,威胁
tight紧的+en变成→v.变紧,绷紧,拉紧
wake叫醒+en变成→v.醒来 v.唤醒
weak弱的+en变成→v.削弱,[使]变弱

sentences.en: The room was full of wooden furniture.
sentences.cn: 房间里摆满了木制家具。

sentences.en: She gave the stranger a wooden stare.
sentences.cn: 她呆头呆脑地瞧着那个陌生人。

jushi.english: She has a rather wooden manner.
Please put the dish onto that wooden platter.
